element.name: Revenge of the Nagged and the Damned Ivy Scrambler by Kili or bust, Unknown Cache (5/1.5)

center.font: Visit The Geocaching Ireland discussion forum HERE

br.br:
THE COORDINATES ABOVE ARE JUST FOR GENERAL GUIDANCE, THEY WILL NOT LEAD TO THE CACHE. THIS IS A PRETTY DIFFICULT CACHE TO DECIPHER AND THEN FIND.
VISITORS AND DISTANCE CACHERS **BE WARNED!** IN CERTAIN CIRCUMSTANCES THIS CACHE CAN BE FOUND IN ONE VISIT. UNLESS YOU COME PREPARED, AND PERHAPS EQUIPPED, IT WILL PROBABLY TAKE MORE THAN ONE VISIT.
TO START YOU WILL HAVE TO WORK OUT THE "PUZZLE" IN THE IMAGE ABOVE.
The cache is a decontamination box with one or two nice things for an FTF to choose.
The Phoenix Park is a great Dublin amenity but it can become pretty muddy in winter so be prepared for that (stout shoes or boots etc..) Speaking of winter, it is probably best to attempt this cache at that time due to the lack of tree cover. Finding the cache can be done any time of year but I imagine a little more difficult in the summer.
Die hards might like to try this without the hints below of which there are several!

element.encoded-hints: under (might help to look up!) in time, eyes peeled for little Ivy or Mary?
element.url-name: Revenge of the Nagged and the Damned Ivy Scrambler

ul.li:
2009-08-23T19:00:00Z : Found it by Jumpin Jiminie
Finally found it yesterday with Kavdublin.
Kind of sad to see this one go! It got me through many a quiet day in work trying to figure it out.
Many thanks to Kili or Bust for this one and we look forward to the next one.

2009-08-23T19:00:00Z : Found it by kavdublin
great cache, hard and did take time,and the hepl of others but well done! looking forward to more of kili or bust caches's. cheers.

2009-03-29T19:00:00Z : Found it by xenotime
my lucky day! great cache and great fun. So much easier without the vegetation. TFTC :-)))

2009-03-05T20:00:00Z : Found it by Fjon
Finally got it! I played around with the first part for quite a while, and then with a little hint managed to locate it. The next part took 5 separate visits. After the owner replaced it (it was indeed gone) it was easy peasy to finish off the cache. This is one of the cache I've spent most time on and it was very satisfying to finally have it in my hands. Thanks for the (mostly) fun experience, now please no more!

2009-03-04T20:00:00Z : Owner Maintenance by Kili or bust
Apologies to Fjon who has been searching diligently for this one for a while. I checked today and one stage was indeed missing. Replaced now so should be good to go!

wpt.name: GC124Q0
wpt.desc: Revenge of the Nagged and the Damned Ivy Scrambler by Kili or bust, Unknown Cache (5/1.5)
wpt.urlname: Revenge of the Nagged and the Damned Ivy Scrambler

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
THE COORDINATES ABOVE ARE JUST FOR GENERAL GUIDANCE, THEY WILL NOT LEAD TO THE CACHE. THIS IS A PRETTY DIFFICULT CACHE TO DECIPHER AND THEN FIND.
VISITORS AND DISTANCE CACHERS **BE WARNED!** IN CERTAIN CIRCUMSTANCES THIS CACHE CAN BE FOUND IN ONE VISIT. UNLESS YOU COME PREPARED, AND PERHAPS EQUIPPED, IT WILL PROBABLY TAKE MORE THAN ONE VISIT.
TO START YOU WILL HAVE TO WORK OUT THE "PUZZLE" IN THE IMAGE ABOVE.
The cache is a decontamination box with one or two nice things for an FTF to choose.
The Phoenix Park is a great Dublin amenity but it can become pretty muddy in winter so be prepared for that (stout shoes or boots etc..) Speaking of winter, it is probably best to attempt this cache at that time due to the lack of tree cover. Finding the cache can be done any time of year but I imagine a little more difficult in the summer.
Die hards might like to try this without the hints below of which there are several!

Kind of sad to see this one go! It got me through many a quiet day in work trying to figure it out.
Many thanks to Kili or Bust for this one and we look forward to the next one.
great cache, hard and did take time,and the hepl of others but well done! looking forward to more of kili or bust caches's. cheers.
my lucky day! great cache and great fun. So much easier without the vegetation. TFTC :-)))

Finally got it! I played around with the first part for quite a while, and then with a little hint managed to locate it. The next part took 5 separate visits. After the owner replaced it (it was indeed gone) it was easy peasy to finish off the cache. This is one of the cache I've spent most time on and it was very satisfying to finally have it in my hands. Thanks for the (mostly) fun experience, now please no more!
Apologies to Fjon who has been searching diligently for this one for a while. I checked today and one stage was indeed missing. Replaced now so should be good to go!
